page.title: 02WILD LIFE AROUND GRAFTON
page.content: Temple Grafton is a quiet village and it is not very large but it has plenty of wildlife. At the beginning of Spring celandines start to bud. Later on you can see them looking up to the sky. Around the middle of Spring daisies become the most common flower, and you can see them almost everywhere. Even later on you can see the bright yellow petals of buttercups and dandelions. These two flowers are different in the way that their petals are set out. Speedwell is a small light purple flower which spreads across the ground. It comes out about the beginning of summer. The population of trees in Temple Grafton is quite large. Plum trees are early in budding so that the plums have time to ripen. The Horse Chestnut has white blossom which is in the shape of candles.
